sourcesContent:
export const questionObj = {"Qtext": "
 A rectangular water tank has length 6 m, breadth 17 m and capacity \(306 m^3\). 
 A model of the water tank is to made with capacity of \(306000 cm^3\). Find\\
 (i) the dimensions of the model\\
 (ii) the ratio of the total surface area of the tank to that model.\\
", "Steps": [{"id": "s1", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "$$\text{ Let,the model of the tank is made to scale } 1 : k,\\$$
 $$\text{Capacity of tank} = k^3 \times Capacity of model\\$$
 $$(306 \times 100 \times 100 \times 100) = (k^3 \times 306000)\\$$
 $$k^3 = \frac{306 \times 100 \times 100 \times 100}{306000} = 1000$\\$$
 $$k=10\\$$
 $$(i) Length of the tank = k \times Length of the model\\$$ 
 \begin{align*}
 \text{Length of the tank} = k \times \text{Length of the model}\\
 6 \times 100 &= 10 \times \text{Length of the model}\\
 \text{Length of the model} = 60 cm\\
 \text{Breadth of the tank} = k \times \text{Breadth of the model}\\
 17 \times 100 &= 10 \times \text{Breadth of the model}\\
 \text{Breadth of the model} = 170 cm\\
 \text{Height of the model} = \frac{Capacity of model}{length \times breadth}\\
 = \frac{306000}{60 \times 170} = 30 cm\\
 \end{align*}
 (ii) 
 \begin{align*}
 \text{Area of the Tank} = k^2 \times \text{Area of the model}\\
 \frac{\text{Area of the Tank}}{\text{Area of the model}} = k^2 = 100\\
 \text{Area of the Tank} : \text{Area of the Model} = 100 : 1
 \end{align*} 
"}]} 

 export const resp = [{"data": [], "text": " "}]
